body_html: My bad. tf.losses.mean_squared_error is indeed mean square error. The bad naming is actually the default reduction=Reduction.SUM_BY_NONZERO_WEIGHTS. I thought it is a sum but this reduction method is actually an average over nonzero weights.
body_text: My bad. tf.losses.mean_squared_error is indeed mean square error. The bad naming is actually the default reduction=Reduction.SUM_BY_NONZERO_WEIGHTS. I thought it is a sum but this reduction method is actually an average over nonzero weights.
body: My bad. `tf.losses.mean_squared_error` is indeed __mean__ square error. The bad naming is actually the default `reduction=Reduction.SUM_BY_NONZERO_WEIGHTS`. I thought it is a sum but this reduction method is actually an average over nonzero weights.
